definitions.definition: a painting, drawing or photograph of a person, especially of the head and shoulders
definitions.labels: (US English)(US English)(US English)(especially British English)(North American English usually)(British English)(North American English)

examples.text: He had his portrait painted in uniform.
a portrait of the Queen by Annigoni
Vermeer's ‘Portrait of the artist in his studio’
a portrait of life at the French court
The film paints a portrait of a man consumed with jealousy.
The book drew a stark portrait of Quebec's urban poor.
The novel provides a vivid portrait of the Holberg family.
Her first film was a stunning portrait of life in the sugar plantations of her native Martinique.

definitions.definition: the way of printing a document in which the top of the page is one of the shorter sides

examples.text: You can print landscape and portrait pages in the same document.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: from French, past participle (used as a noun) of Old French portraire ‘portray’.
